review: I have used Roku, Google TV and Chromecaster.  I like the First TV stick for many reasons.  The first is the remote. The remote is much higher quality than what comes with the base Roku devices.  I like the interface and particularly the control I have over kids.  The device has some very interesting game options and the remote works well with them.  I would give this five stars but doesn't support HBO  Go and some other services.
author: NorhLoudspeaker

review: I've used the Roku, Apple TV, and Android TV (Nexus Player).  This works as well as any of them, it's just the interface is a complete mess.  From the downloading of apps to the launching of apps, this product is so Amazon-centric that it's a hinderance to use any other service.  I like either Roku or Android TV better.  Apple TV is the worst of the bunch.  It is a complete mess.
author: A. Davies "adogg"

review: OK, I probably didn't need another gadget to plug in (had to buy another HDMI switch), but the lure of Amazon Prime movies, etc. was too great.  So far I have been very pleased.  It worked right out of the box (my Amazon account was pre-loaded), and the interface is pretty straightforward. The remote works just fine and the content on Amazon Prime is excellent.  Wish it had a VUDU app since I have some things located there, but I can use my Apple TV for that.If you have Amazon Prime, I'd highly recommend this purchase.  It's well worth the price.
